attributes.action: Do not slash Higher Education funding of Archaeology and Arts subjects
attributes.additional_details: The Office for Students (OfS) proposes to slash the recurring budget for  subjects including Archaeology by 50%. This signifies an effective death sentence for a subject in which the UK boasts the top 4 institutions globally, and which contributes directly to the heritage sector and £31 billion in national tourism revenue per year.
attributes.background: The government must scrap plans to cut funding of Archaeology and Arts subjects in Higher Education by 50%, as outlined in the recent Office for Students (OfS) consultation on recurrent funding (deadline 6th May 2021).

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/572300
